tools.via.storage module¶

Manage storage between local and aws buckets.

Bases: tools.aws.awsTools.Bucket, tools.via.storage.Storage

Aws bucket storage

class tools.via.storage.Local(folder: str)¶

Bases: tools.via.storage.Storage

Read file from a given folder and store in memory.

class tools.via.storage.Storage¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Storage interface

abstract list_files() → list¶

list all file in the storage.

Returns

list of all files.

abstract read(file) → bytes¶

Read a file and return it in bytes. Need to implement.

Parameters

file – file

Returns

file bytes

tools.via.storage.storage_factory(local: bool, storage_path: str, **kwargs) → tools.via.storage.Storage¶

factory return the the good storage object (local or aws) in function of local variable.

Parameters

  • local – boolean False use bucket, true local storage

  • storage_path – path of the image folder or bucket name

Keyword
key bucket_name (str)

name of the bucket.

key profile (str)

Choose AWS CLI profile if more than 1 are set up.

Returns

Storage object.

tools.via.via_converter module¶

class tools.via.via_converter.ViaConverter(cloud_name: str, local: bool, source_path: str, profile: str = 'default')¶

Bases: object

request_generator(list_image: list) → Iterator[Tuple[str, Union[dict, google.cloud.vision_v1.types.image_annotator.AnnotateImageResponse]]]¶
Return an iterator which return a tuple:

  • name of image

  • result of the cloud text detection (aws or gcloud)

For each listed file. The file use can be store locally or in aws bucket.

Parameters

list_image – list all image to annotate.

Returns

iterator, tuple name of image and google vision response for gcloud or python dict for aws.

via_json(list_image: list) → dict¶

Build dict for VGG Image Annotator with annotation from cloud.

Parameters

list_image – list all image to annotate.

Returns

dict with via format

via_json_save_locally(list_file: Union[None, list] = None) → None¶

Save locally in json the result of the via json for all the image in folder.

Parameters

list_file – list all image to annotate. if None use all file in buckets or folder.
